artciles.q: Which is the major functioning responsibility of the multiplexing combinational circuit?
artciles.opt2: Generation of all minterms in an output function with OR-gate
artciles.opt3: Generation of selected path between multiple sources and a single destination
artciles.answer: Generation of selected path between multiple sources and a single destination

artciles.q: What is the function of an enable input on a multiplexer chip?
artciles.answer: c) To active the entire chip
artciles.description: Explanation: Enable input is used to active the chip, when enable is high the chip works (ACTIVE), when enable is low the chip does not work (MEMORY). However, Enable can be Active-High or Active-Low, indicating it is active either when it is connected to VCC or GND respectively.

artciles.q: One multiplexer can take the place of ___________
artciles.opt2: Several SSI logic gates or combinational logic circuits
artciles.answer: Several SSI logic gates or combinational logic circuits
artciles.decription: A multiplexer (or MUX) is a device that selects one of several analog or digital input signals and forwards the selected input into a single line, depending on the active select lines. Since many operational behaviour can be performed by using a multiplexer. Whereas, a combinational circuit is a combination of many logic gates which makes the circuit more complex.

artciles.q: A digital multiplexer is a combinational circuit that selects ___________
artciles.opt1: One digital information from several sources and transmits the selected one
artciles.opt2: Many digital information and convert them into one
artciles.opt3: Many decimal outputs and accepts the selected information
artciles.answer: One digital information from several sources and transmits the selected one
artciles.description: A digital multiplexer is a combinational circuit that selects one digital information from several sources and transmits the selected information on a single output line depending on the status of the select lines. That is why it is also known as a data selector.

artciles.q: In a multiplexer, the selection of a particular input line is controlled by ___________
artciles.opt3: Both data controller and selected lines
artciles.description: The selection of a particular input line is controlled by a set of selected lines in a multiplexer, which helps to select a particular input from several sources.

artciles.q: If the number of n selected input lines is equal to 2^m then it requires _____ select lines.
artciles.description: If the number of n selected input lines is equal to 2^m then it requires m select lines to select one of m select lines.

artciles.q: How many select lines would be required for an 8-line-to-1-line multiplexer?
artciles.description: 2^n input lines, n control lines and 1 output line available for MUX. Here, 8 input lines mean two 3 inputs. So, 3 control lines are possible. Depending on the status of the select lines, the input is selected and fed to the output.

artciles.q: A basic multiplexer principle can be demonstrated through the use of a ___________
artciles.description: A basic multiplexer principle can be demonstrated through the use of a rotary switch. Since its behaviour is similar to the multiplexer. There are around 10 digits out of which one is selected one at a time and fed to the output.
